intro: Byrsonima verbascifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf false flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting species for ecological and horticultural study.
